verses.kjv: When Israel was a child, then I loved him, and called my son out of Egypt.
verses.web: “When Israel was a child, then I loved him, and called my son out of Egypt.
verses.ct: "When Israel was a child, I loved him, and I called my son out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: As they called them, so they went from them: they sacrificed unto Baalim, and burned incense to graven images.
verses.web: They called to them, so they went from them. They sacrificed to the Baals, and burned incense to engraved images.
verses.ct: But the more I called to them, the further they walked away from me. They offered sacrifices to the Baals and burned incense to carved idols.

verses.kjv: I taught Ephraim also to go, taking them by their arms; but they knew not that I healed them.
verses.web: Yet I taught Ephraim to walk. I took them by his arms; but they didn’t know that I healed them.
verses.ct: It was I who taught Ephraim to walk, taking them by the arms. But they never realized it was I who healed them.

verses.kjv: I drew them with cords of a man, with bands of love: and I was to them as they that take off the yoke on their jaws, and I laid meat unto them.
verses.web: I drew them with cords of a man, with ties of love; and I was to them like those who lift up the yoke on their necks; and I bent down to him and I fed him.
verses.ct: I led them with gentle cords, with ties of love. I was like someone who lifts the yoke from their neck. I bent down and fed them.

verses.kjv: He shall not return into the land of Egypt, but the Assyrian shall be his king, because they refused to return.
verses.web: “They won’t return into the land of Egypt; but the Assyrian will be their king, because they refused to repent.
verses.ct: They won't return to the land of Egypt, but Assyria will rule over them — because they refused to repent.

verses.kjv: And the sword shall abide on his cities, and shall consume his branches, and devour them, because of their own counsels.
verses.web: The sword will fall on their cities, and will destroy the bars of their gates, and will put an end to their plans.
verses.ct: The sword will sweep through their cities, smashing their gate bars and devouring them because of their own schemes.

verses.kjv: And my people are bent to backsliding from me: though they called them to the most High, none at all would exalt him.
verses.web: My people are determined to turn from me. Though they call to the Most High, he certainly won’t exalt them.
verses.ct: My people are determined to turn away from me. Even when prophets call them to the Most High, not one of them will lift their eyes to him.

verses.kjv: How shall I give thee up, Ephraim? how shall I deliver thee, Israel? how shall I make thee as Admah? how shall I set thee as Zeboim? mine heart is turned within me, my repentings are kindled together.
verses.web: “How can I give you up, Ephraim? How can I hand you over, Israel? How can I make you like Admah? How can I make you like Zeboiim? My heart is turned within me, my compassion is aroused.
verses.ct: "How can I give you up, Ephraim? How can I hand you over, Israel? How can I destroy you like Admah? How can I treat you like Zeboiim? My heart is torn inside me; my compassion is overwhelming.

verses.kjv: I will not execute the fierceness of mine anger, I will not return to destroy Ephraim: for I am God, and not man; the Holy One in the midst of thee: and I will not enter into the city.
verses.web: I will not execute the fierceness of my anger. I will not return to destroy Ephraim: for I am God, and not man; the Holy One among you; and I will not come in wrath.
verses.ct: I will not unleash the full fury of my anger. I will not come back to destroy Ephraim. For I am God and not a man — the Holy One among you — and I will not come in wrath.

verses.kjv: They shall walk after the LORD: he shall roar like a lion: when he shall roar, then the children shall tremble from the west.
verses.web: They will walk after LORD, who will roar like a lion; for he will roar, and the children will come trembling from the west.
verses.ct: They will follow the LORD, and he will roar like a lion. When he roars, his children will come trembling from the west.

verses.kjv: They shall tremble as a bird out of Egypt, and as a dove out of the land of Assyria: and I will place them in their houses, saith the LORD.
verses.web: They will come trembling like a bird out of Egypt, and like a dove out of the land of Assyria; and I will settle them in their houses,” says LORD.
verses.ct: They will come trembling like birds from Egypt, like doves from the land of Assyria, and I will settle them back in their homes," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Ephraim compasseth me about with lies, and the house of Israel with deceit: but Judah yet ruleth with God, and is faithful with the saints.
verses.web: Ephraim surrounds me with falsehood, and the house of Israel with deceit. Judah still strays from God, and is unfaithful to the Holy One.
verses.ct: Ephraim surrounds me with lies, and the house of Israel with deceit. But Judah still walks with God and remains faithful to the Holy One.
